awd_titl_txt: Synthetic Uses of Aminoiminomethanesulfonic Acids and       Related Compounds (Chemistry)
awd_abstract_narration: This is a Career Advancement Award (CAA) of the Research                        Opportunities for Women Initiative (ROW) that is being                          supported by the Organic and Macromolecular Chemistry Program                   of the Chemistry Division.  This will provide Dr. Audrey                        Miller, who has had a long career, primarily in teaching, with                  the resources, personnel and time to develop a research program.                                                                                                This research explores the synthetic utility of                                 aminomethane-sulfonic acids, hydrazinoiminomethanesulfonic                      acids, aminoiminoacetoninitriles and                                            hydrazinoiminoacetonitriles.  The nucleophilic substitution                     reactions of these classes of compounds will be studied with                    1) hydroxylamine, 2) a variety of enamines and 3)                               functionalized carbanions.  The proper choice of reagents will                  permit the synthesis of a wide variety of 4-, 5-, 6- and                        7-membered heterocyclic ring systems. These may contain                         multiple heteroatoms (N,S,0).
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
